caption:
The photograph depicts a scene from an urban setting, possibly during the late 1960s or early 1970s, where a group of people is engaged in the activity of boarding a city bus. The bus, a vintage model colored white and silver, has a rounded, streamlined body design and features large, clear windows. It is parked in a spacious parking lot.

In the foreground, there is a car, possibly a Ford Mustang or similar coupe, which reflects the automotive styles of the period. Behind the bus, a large department store serves as the background. The store features a bland, typical mid-20th century commercial architecture with a simple, unadorned brown brick facade. Signage on the building is minimal, but the name "LESIER" is partially visible in faded letters.

The group of people waiting to board the bus includes about a dozen individuals, both men and women. They are dressed in typical attire of the period: men in suits and overcoats, many wearing hats, and women in coats that reach mid-calf, accessorized with bags and possibly scarves. This attire suggests a cooler weather setting.

Overall, the composition captures a routine moment of city life, characterized by daily transportation, subdued winter clothing, and a backdrop of commercial architecture. The image portrays a slice of urban Americana, emphasizing the communal and sometimes monotonous aspects of daily work commutes in an industrial age cityscape.
title: Early morning express bus from Maryland suburb to Washington, DC
